The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is essentially the brain of the computer. It interprets and executes instructions and data contained in software programs. The more generic term 'processor' is often used to refer to a CPU as well. A processor can execute instructions more quickly using a faster clock speed, resulting in increased performance of the processor and system. Clock speed is still an important feature contributing to performance, especially when comparing processors based on the same core, for example, a 3GHz Prescott core Pentium 4 is faster than a 2.8GHz processor using the same core.
If you need the fastest speeds in your computer, select a CPU from the bottom of the list.
